adjective.description: (of a place) able to be reached or entered.
examples: the town is accessible by bus
this room is not accessible to elderly people

adjective.description: (of a person, typically one in a position of authority or importance) friendly and easy to talk to; approachable.
examples: he is more accessible than most tycoons

origin: Late Middle English: from late Latin accessibilis, from Latin access- approached, from the verb accedere (see accede).
